definition: Li Na (1982-), Chinese tennis player, first Asian player to win a Grand Slam singles title (2011 French Open women's singles)
plum
surname Li
(phonetic na)/used esp. in female names such as Anna 安娜[An1 na4] or Diana 黛安娜[Dai4 an1 na4]
elegant/graceful

sentences.english: After serving out the first set, Li broke in the opening game of the second set.
sentences.chinese: 拿下第一盤之後，李娜在第二盤破發對手一個發球局。

sentences.english: But Li should hardly walk into Rod Laver Arena without belief Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 但李娜週四沒有信念很難走到中心球場。

sentences.english: I calculate that Aunt Lena will arrive at 8.00 p. m.
sentences.chinese: 我估計李娜阿姨將於下午八點到達。

sentences.english: Whatever the reason, the CTA did agree three years ago to allow Li to fly alone.
sentences.chinese: 無論何種原因，三年前網協確實同意了李娜單飛。

sentences.english: Li Na , I'd like to introduce you to my assistant, Li Hui.
sentences.chinese: 李娜，我想把你介紹給我的助手李輝。

sentences.english: Li Na has been credited with popularising tennis in China.
sentences.chinese: 由於李娜的表現，網球運動在中國越來越受歡迎。

sentences.english: Third athlete was Li Na, another Tennis Star.
sentences.chinese: 第三位運動員是李娜，另外一位網球巨星。

sentences.english: Li Na's training partner on the day, another Czech, Daniela Hantuchova.
sentences.chinese: 李娜當天的訓練夥伴是另一名捷克選手漢圖楚娃。

sentences.english: Ads run by Rolex today have highlighted its ties to Li.
sentences.chinese: 今天，勞力士的廣告則凸顯了其與李娜之間的聯繫。

sentences.english: In the Chinese tennis world five artificial flowers with gold-foil , Li Na and Peng Shuaijiang absents this sports events.
sentences.chinese: 中國網壇五朵金花中，李娜和彭帥將缺席本屆賽事。

sentences.english: Li is the newly-crowned first-ever Chinese Grand Slam tournament winner.
sentences.chinese: 李娜是第一位新加冕的中國大滿貫錦標賽冠軍。

sentences.english: Li Na reaches her first semifinals after Melbourne with new coach.
sentences.chinese: 李娜師和新教練在墨爾本比賽後，首次打進半決賽。

sentences.english: I should say Li Na is a true pal and a good girl.
sentences.chinese: 我應該說一句，李娜不僅夠朋友，還是個好女孩兒。

sentences.english: Chinese top seed Li Na will get her tournament underway tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 中國頭號種子李娜將於明天開始進行錦標賽。

sentences.english: Li, with her tattoos and dyed hair, is regularly referred to in China as a rebel.
sentences.chinese: 有紋身且染髮的李娜在中國常常被認爲是一個叛逆者。

definition: Wang Nan (1978-), female PRC table tennis player, Olympic medalist
Liu Xiang (1983-), Chinese gold-medal hurdler of the 2004 Olympic Games
Deng Yaping (1973-), table tennis player, several times world and Olympic winner
variant of 叮嚀|叮咛[ding1 ning2]
Wang Liqin (1978-), former PRC table tennis player, Olympic medalist
grand slam
Zhang Yining (1981-), PRC female table tennis player and Olympic gold medalist
Australian Open (tennis tournament)
Hu Jia (1973-), PRC dissident human rights activist
Sharapova (Russian female tennis star)
Qiao Hong (1968-), former PRC female table tennis player
Wang Junxia (1973-), Chinese long-distance runner
Wimbledon Championships (tennis)/abbr. for 溫布爾登網球公開賽|温布尔登网球公开赛[Wen1 bu4 er3 deng1 Wang3 qiu2 Gong1 kai1 sai4]
table tennis/ping-pong/table tennis ball/CL:個|个[ge4]
graceful
abbr. for 奧林匹克運動會|奥林匹克运动会/Olympic Games/the Olympics
